IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: EDUCATION OF PRESCHOOL THROUGH GRADE 12 STUDENTS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: BELLEVUE CHRISTIAN SCHOOL'S MISSION IS TO PREPARE YOUNG PEOPLE TO LIVE FULLY FOR GOD IN A RAPIDLY CHANGING WORLD, WITH THE ABILITY TO UNDERSTAND, EVALUATE, AND TRANSFORM THEIR WORLD FROM THE FOUNDATION OF GOD'S UNCHANGING VALUES.
IRS990.Description: BELLEVUE CHRISTIAN SCHOOL ("BCS") PROVIDES PRESCHOOL THROUGH GRADE 12 EDUCATION WITH THE GOAL OF PREPARING STUDENTS TO BECOME CHRISTIAN LEADERS. FOUNDED IN 1952,THE SCHOOL ENROLLS APPROXIMATELY 1100 STUDENTS WHO MAKE UP AN ACADEMICALLY, ECONOMICALLY AND CULTURALLY DIVERSE STUDENT BODY. THE SCHOOL IS LOCATED IN WASHINGTON STATE AND OFFERS PROGRAMS IN FOUR (4) LOCATIONS - A JUNIOR-HIGH AND SENIOR HIGH CAMPUS IN CLYDE HILL, ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS IN MEDINA AND WOODINVILLE AND PRESCHOOLS IN WOODINVILLE, MEDINA AND BELLEVUE. THE SCHOOL IS ACCREDITED THROUGH CHRISTIAN SCHOOLS INTERNATIONAL ("CSI") AND A FOUNDING MEMBER OF THE WASHINGTON FEDERATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS. BCS GRADUATES APPROXIMATELY 80-90 SENIORS EACH YEAR, OVER 98% OF WHOM GO ON TO HIGHER EDUCATION. THE SCHOOL PROVIDES A FULL SPECTRUM OF PROGRAMS TO ITS STUDENTS, INCLUDING ATHLETICS, AFTER SCHOOL CARE, SUMMER PROGRAMS, SPECIAL EDUCATION, ENRICHMENT, AP COURSES AND PERFORMING ARTS, AND EMPLOYS APPROXIMATELY 350 FULL TIME AND PART TIME FACULTY, ADMINISTRATIVE AND SUPPORT STAFF.

OtherLiabilities.Description: INTEREST RATE SWAP - FAIR MARKET VALUE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: BCS became the trustee of an estate under a Unitrust agreement dated 12/16/1993. Under the terms of this Charitable Remainder Trust ("the trust") BCS acts as trustee for the entire amount of the trust and upon the death of both trustors the estate will be terminated and distributed 50% to BCS and 50% to another unrelated tax-exempt organization. Until the trust is terminated the trustors receive all the earnings benefit of the trust. The value of the estate on 6/30/10 WAS $234,090 IF WHICH $117,045 IS INCLUDED AS OTHER SECURITIES. ADDITIONS INCLUDE INTEREST AND DIVIDEND INCOME OF $2,481 AND REALIZED AND UNREALIZED GAINS OF $8,644.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: BCS' ENDOWMENT FUNDS FUNCTION AS PERMANENT ENDOWMENTS, THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF WHICH IS TO PROVIDE CURRENT INCOME, PRINCIPALLY FOR THE PURPOSE OF FINANCIAL AID, OPERATIONS, FACILITIES OR AS DIRECTED BY THE DONORS OR THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.
DEPRECIATION BOOK/TAX DIFFERENCE: 107028. INTEREST RATE SWAP - FAIR MARKET VALUE ADJUSTMENT: -7784. VALUE OF MISC IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVED: -8684.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: STATED IN SCHOOL ADVERTISING, PUBLICATONS, PRINTED MATERIAL & ANNUAL PUBLICATION IN AREA NEWSPAPERS AS NOTED IN SEC. 4.03 OF REV PROC 75-50.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED 6/30/10 BELLEVUE CHRISTIAN SCHOOL RECEIVED "ESEA TITLE II, PART A" FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $10,793. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS THE FUNDS WERE USED FOR TEACHER PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: TUITION REDUCTION IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL AID

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: TUITION REDUCTION IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FAMILIES' ABILITY TO PAY. FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE which IS MADE UP OF AT LEAST TWO BOARD MEMBERS AND VOLUNTEERS FROM THE SCHOOL COMMUNITY WHO HAVE BACKGROUD IN FINANCE. FAMILIES SEEKING FINANCIAL AID ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A COMPREHENSIVE APPLICATION PACKET AND SUBMIT IT TO SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICES ("SSS"), A DIVISION OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS ("NAIS"). SSS PROCESSES FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS ON BEHALF OF THE SCHOOL AND REPORTS EACH APPLICANT'S ABILITY TO PAY TUITION, BASED UPON WHICH AID IS GRANTED. FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS ARE DUE BY FEBRUARY 28 FOR THE UPCOMING SCHOOL YEAR. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE GIVEN ANNUALLY EACH SPRING FOR THE FOLLOWING SCHOOL YEAR, AND MUST BE RE-CALCULATED AND REVIEWED EACH YEAR FOR RETURNING FAMILIES BASED ON ESTABLISHED PARAMETERS. THE SCHOOL'S GOAL IS TO AWARD APPROXIMATELY 10% OF ITS TUITION REVENUE AS FINANCIAL AID. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS ISSUED IN THE FORM OF TUITION CREDIT. AWARDEES WHO LEAVE THE SCHOOL DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR FORFEIT THEIR REMAINING AID AND THE UNUSED AMOUNT IS RETURNED TO THE SCHOOL.

OtherNonCashContributionsTable.MethodOfDeterminingRevenues: ESTIMATE OF FMV USING COMPARABLE SALES METHOD
ESTIMATE OF FMV USING COMPARABLE SALES METHOD

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BCS IS ORGANIZED AS A NONSTOCK NONPROFIT CORPORATION. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BCS ARTICLES AND BYLAWS THE CORPORATION HAS MEMBERS. AS OF 6/30/10 THERE ARE 48 CORPORATION MEMBERS. MEMBERS RECEIVE NO RENUMERATION AND NO MORE THAN 50% OF THE MEMBERS CAN BE BCS EMPLOYEES. ASSETS OF THE CORPORATION AND ANY EXCESS OF INCOME OVER EXPENESE OF THE CORPORATION SHALL NOT BE DISTRIBUTED TO THE MEMBERS, BUT SHALL BE USED BY THE BOARD TO FURTHER THE PURPOSES OF THE CORPORATION. CORPORATION MEMBERS ARE ELECTED BY A TWO-THIRDS MAJORITY OF CURRENT MEMBERSHIP. THE AFFAIRS OF THE COPORATION ARE MANAGED BY A BOARD OF DIRECTORS ELECTED FROM AMONG CORPORATION MEMBERS. THE QUALIFICATIONS OF DIRECTORS, THE MANNER OF THEIR SELECTION, TERMS OF OFFICE AND MANNER FOR REMOVING A DIRECTOR ARE PROVIDED IN THE BYLAWS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: IN ACCORDANCE WITH BELLEVUE CHRISTIAN SCHOOL'S "BOARD POLICY GOVERNING BUSINESS AND FINANCE" THE BCS BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE ANNUAL IRS FORM 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED. NO BOARD RESOLUTION IS REQUIRED FOR THE FORM 990 TO BE FILED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH BELLEVUE CHRISTIAN SCHOOL BOARD MEMBER, OFFICER AND KEY EMPLOYEE IS REQUIRED TO ANNUALLY SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT ASSENTING TO THE CONDITIONS SET FORTH IN THE BCS "CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND DISCLOSURE POLICY," DISCLOSING ANY EXISTING OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REVIEWED AND RESOLVED USING THE PROCEDURES SET FORTH IN THE AFORE-MENTIONED POLICY WHICH INCLUDE COMPLETE DISCLOSURE, INCLUSION IN THE BOARD MINUTES AND A 2/3 BOARD APPROVAL WITH ABSTENTION BY THE MEMBER IN CONFLICT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION OF THE SUPERINTENDENT AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED ANNUALLY BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTE OF THE BOARD. ALL SALARY SCHEDULES ARE APPROVED ANNUALLY BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND THE BOARD AS PART OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET DECISION. AS PART OF THIS PROCESS THE FINANCE COMMITTE REVIEWS MULITIPLE SALARY DATA SOURCES FOR COMPARISON PURPOSES INCLUDING CSI, NAIS AND PNAIS ANNUAL COMPENSATION REPORTS, SALARY INFORMATION FROM LOCAL PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SCHOOLS, OTHER SCHOOLS' FORM 990 RETURNS AND INTERNET RESOURCES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BCS' APPLICABLE TAX FORMS - FORM 1023, 990 AND 990-T (WHEN APPLICABLE) ARE AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW UPON REQUEST IN OUR OFFICES DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS. IN ADDITION, BCS' GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW UPON REQUEST IN OUR OFFICES DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS. SOME OR ALL OF THESE DOCUMENTS MAY ALSO BE AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE AT BELLEVUECHRISTIAN.ORG.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANNUALLY APPOINTS THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM WHO IS TO PERFORM THE AUDIT. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE AUDITED FINANICAL STATEMENTS ANNUALLY.

THE VOLUNTEER ESTIMATE OF 400 WAS ARRIVED AT AS FOLLOWS - BCS HAS APPROXIMATELY 700 FAMILIES, SOME OF WHICH ARE SINGLE-PARENT FAMILIES, SO THE SCHOOL ESTIMATES THAT THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 1200 PARENTS AT BCS. BCS POLLED THEIR OFFICE MANAGERS AND MOST ACTIVE PARENT VOLUNTEERS AND ESTIMATED THAT ABOUT ONE THIRD (1/3) OF THE BCS PARENTS VOLUNTEER AT THE SCHOOL. PARENT VOLUNTEERS ARE AN INTEGRAL PART OF BCS AND PROVIDE A MUCH NEEDED WIDE ARRAY OF SERVICES AT THE SCHOOL. PARENT VOLUNTEERS SERVE ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND COMMITTEES, PROVIDE HELP IN THE CLASSROOM AND IN PLANNING AND ORGANIZING SPECIAL EVENTS (SUCH AS THE AUCTION). PARENT VOLUNTEERS CHAPERONE STUDENT ACTIVITIES AND FIELD TRIPS, ASSIST WITH SPECIAL PROJECTS AND IN NUMEROUS FUND RAISING VENTURES, THEY MANAGE THE "PTF" (PARENT-TEACHER FELLOWSHIP), BOOSTERS, AND WORK IN THE DELI, TO NAME SOME OF THE MORE SIGNIFICANT VOLUNTEER SERVICE AREAS.
